text: hey everybody welcome back to the channel today we're focusing on a pepper that's spicy versatile and a favorite in many kitchens the Sano pepper whether you're a seasoned Gardener or just starting out this pepper is a must have for anyone who loves growing their own food let's explore everything you need to know about the Sorano pepper did you know that the sorrano peppers can be up to five times hotter than jalapenos soranos range between 10,000 and 25,000 Scoville heat units making them a great choice if you're looking to add a serious kick to your dishes and unlike some chili varieties sanos retain their bright fresh flavor even as they mature making them perfect for fresh Salsas and hot sauces the sorrano pepper is native to the mountainous regions of playo and hildo in Mexico its name comes from the Spanish word for mountains reflecting its Origins it has been cultivated in Mexico for hundreds of years and remains a staple in Mexican Cuisine particularly in dishes like pic dealo Salas and sauces today surrounds are popular worldwide for their heat and rich flavor often used for fresh rather than dried like other hot peppers Sorano pepper plants are bushy and compact typically growing until about 2 to 3et tall the peppers themselves are slender cylindrical and usually about 1 to 2 in long though they can grow up to 4 in when immature surrounds are green but they ripen to vibrant shades of red orange and yellow depending on the variety these peppers grow in clusters on the plant and can be harvested at any stage of ripeness depending on your heat preference if you're ready to grow surr peppers is important to provide them with the right conditions sanos thrive in warm climates and need plenty of sunshine at least 6 8 hours of full sun each day they prefer well- draining lomy soil with a pH between 6.0 and 7.0 plant your Sano seeds endur about 8 to 10 weeks before the last frost dat once the ceilings have grown to about 4 in tall and the outdoor temperatures consistently stay above 60° fhe then you can transplant water the plants regularly keeping the soil consistently moist space the plants about 18 to 24 in apart add a layer of mulch around the base of plants which can help retain moisture and keep the roots cool during hot weather serto Peppers benefit from companion planting and there are several vegetables and herbs that grow well alongside them good companions include Tomatoes carrots basil and marry Golds these plants help DET tear pests and can help improve the overall health of your garden for example basil can enhance the flavor of your sanos while Mar gos help repel nematodes which can damage your pepper Roots avoid planting the peppers near fennel as it can stunt the growth of Sano plants one special behavior of Sano plants is ability to continuously produce fruit throughout the growing season provided they're regularly harvested the more you pick the more peppers a plant will produce s peppers are also relatively resistant to Pest and disease making them a low-maintenance crop for most home gardens however keep an eye out for common Garden pests like aphid spites and white flies which can occasionally affect pepper plants Sorano peppers are incredibly versatile in the kitchen because they hold on to their crispness and even when cooked they're great in Salsas guacamole stir fries and pickled recipes you can also use them in fresh STS or roast them to bring out their sweetness sral are packed with capsacin the compound responsible for the heat cap sa has numerous health benefits including boosting metabolism reducing inflammation and improving circulation they're also a great source of vitamin C and A both of which are important for immune health and skin Health serto peppers are a perfect addition to any Garden offering not only their signature heat but also a long growing season and an abundance of uses in the kitchen they're easy to grow productive and a fantastic choice for anyone who loves a little Spice in their life thanks for tuning in today if you found this video helpful don't forget to like share and subscribe for more gardening tips and plant profile and as always always happy growing [Music]
